meanings.sent1: I felt schmucked when the salesman sold me a broken watch.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been schmucked when she saw the fake designer bag.
meanings.sent3: Getting schmucked by that online scam was not fun at all.
meanings.sent4: Being schmucked in that deal was like losing in a game of cards.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being schmucked stayed with him for days.

meanings.definition: To be in a difficult or unpleasant situation.
meanings.sent1: After missing the last bus, I was schmucked in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent2: She felt schmucked when she realized she forgot her wallet at home.
meanings.sent3: Being schmucked without an umbrella in the rain was quite a predicament.
meanings.sent4: The project deadline had me feeling schmucked like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The exam day arrived, and I found myself schmucked without any notes.

meanings.sent1: He accidentally schmucked his head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent2: The baseball schmucked the window, causing it to crack.
meanings.sent3: The ball schmucked him right on the nose during the game.
meanings.sent4: The tree branch schmucked him as he walked by, leaving a mark.
meanings.sent5: The snowball schmucked her squarely in the face, making everyone laugh.
